alert.note: Alert for Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:36PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pinal County through 815 PM MST... At 734 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hayden, moving southwest at 10 mph. Other strong storms continued northeast of Dudleyville. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kearny, Dudleyville, Aravaipa Canyon Wilderness and Kelvin. This includes the following highways... Route 77 between mile markers 124 and 134. Route 177 between mile markers 139 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle
